claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Multipanel figure (panels A–D) showing geometric mean ratios of egg to cell virus titers and proportions of ≥4-fold reduced titers pre- and post-vaccination for four licensed quadrivalent influenza vaccines (Fluzone IIV4, Fluarix IIV4, cell-based IIV4, and recombinant HA RIV4) in two age groups (18–44 and 45–64 years), with p-values comparing immunogenicity measures. does not support the claim because the figure presents immunogenicity comparisons between vaccine types but does not provide any data on HA antigen content (let alone a 3× difference) or link antigen dose to immune response. Note: No mention of HA antigen quantity in the image; immunogenicity data are shown but antigen dose is not specified.

detailed_analysis.reasoning: does not support the claim because the figure presents immunogenicity comparisons between vaccine types but does not provide any data on HA antigen content (let alone a 3× difference) or link antigen dose to immune response.
